db:abstract.db:para: The QFileOpenEvent class provides an event that will be sent when there is a request to open a file or a URL.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: File open events will be sent to the QApplication::instance() when the operating system requests that a file or URL should be opened. This is a high-level event that can be caused by different user actions depending on the user's desktop environment; for example, double clicking on an file icon in the Finder on Mac OS X.
This event is only used to notify the application of a request. It may be safely ignored.

db:note.db:para: This class is currently supported for Mac OS X only.

db:section.db:title: QString QFileOpenEvent::file() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the file that is being opened.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.8] bool QFileOpenEvent::openFile(QFile &file, QIODevice::OpenMode flags) const
db:section.db:para: Opens a QFile on the file referenced by this event in the mode specified by flags. Returns true if successful; otherwise returns false.
This is necessary as some files cannot be opened by name, but require specific information stored in this event.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.8.

db:section.db:title: [since 4.6] QUrl QFileOpenEvent::url() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the url that is being opened.
This function was introduced in Qt 4.6.
